alert.note: Alert for Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sanilac County through 615 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marlette, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Peck around 535 PM EDT. Sandusky around 540 PM EDT. Croswell, Carsonville and Applegate around 550 PM EDT. Lexington around 555 PM EDT. Port Sanilac around 600 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Watertown, McGregor, Forester, Snover, Juhl, Elmer and Richmondville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
